title: QuarkusComponentTest in Gradle
body:

The problem is in QuarkusComponentTestExtension.java. The problem is with this part of the code:

```java
int targetClassesIndex = testPath.indexOf(TARGET_TEST_CLASSES);
// NOTE: continuous testing is not supported at the moment
if (targetClassesIndex == -1) {
    throw new IllegalStateException("Invalid test path: " + testPath);
}
```

Together with

```java
private static final String TARGET_TEST_CLASSES = "target/test-classes";
```

The code is looking if the path to the class with the testcode contains `target/test-classes`. This is true for Maven builds but not for Gradle builds. 

### Expected behavior

I expect to be able to use @QuarkusComponentTest to write component tests with Gradle als build tool and able to run them without the `IllegalStateException: Invalid test path`.

### Actual behavior

At the moment every test class that is annotated with @QuarkusComponentTest in a project that you build with Gradle will fail with `IllegalStateException: Invalid test path`.

### How to Reproduce?

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create a Quarkus project with Gradle as build tool.
2. Create a component test with @QuarkusComponentTest annotation.
3. Run the tests with ./gradlew test or run them from IntelliJ.
